text: There is nothing new in markets. You are just overthinking or not studying market history. Market repeats history again & again. For example Last week expiry & today's expiry are just same. Market created same pattern again specially in banknifty & this time with more ease.

author: Rohit Kadam
text: This will help you to do observation of your own thoughts processing, choices you make & also you will get to know the people who influence you directly or indirectly. Then try to think independently as possible & Be mindful of things around you.

author: Rohit Kadam
text: It's very important in life to create your own style which suits your personality in whatever you do. It may be sports, cooking, investing, fashion or anything else. Learn from everyone but develop your own style in everything, even small things you do. Don't copy Be unique 💯.

author: Rohit Kadam
text: Trade or Invest with intention of learning & market will take care of your earnings. Be competitive but Not Greedy. Challenge yourself use progressive overloading principle which means increase your challenge levels as you get more experienced. Wait for compounding miracle.

author: Rohit Kadam
text: Markets favours those who accepts their mistakes early & takes small losses without any HESITATION (act smoothly no emotional drama). Don't fight with markets. It will change your game forever.

author: Rohit Kadam
text: Stop losses are very important to understand the structure & direction of the markets. So try to understand where will be the most Stop losses are placed & accordingly plan the trade. Your probability of winning will increase dramatically.

author: Rohit Kadam
text: Your trading sense is the best indicator in trading. Work on your trading sense & become invincible.

author: Rohit Kadam
text:
“Take up one idea, make that one idea your life. Think of it, dream of it, Live on that idea let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.”
- Swami Vivekanand
